a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes numerator denominator :: real
assumes h0 : "numerator = 2 - 4 + 6 - 8 + 10 - 12 + 14"
and h1 : "denominator = 3 - 6 + 9 - 12 + 15 - 18 + 21"
shows  "numerator / denominator = 2 / 3"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 What fraction is the same as \[
\frac{2-4+6-8+10-12+14}{3-6+9-12+15-18+21}?
\] The final Answer is \frac{2}{3}
 ### Proof
 We have \begin{align} &\frac{2-4+6-8+10-12+14}{3-6+9-12+15-18+21} \\ & \qquad = \frac{2(1-2+3-4+5-6+7)}{3(1-2+3-4+5-6+7)} \\ & \qquad = \boxed{\frac{2}{3}}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes numerator denominator :: real
assumes h0 : "numerator = 2 - 4 + 6 - 8 + 10 - 12 + 14"
and h1 : "denominator = 3 - 6 + 9 - 12 + 15 - 18 + 21"
shows  "numerator / denominator = 2 / 3"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Find the value of the fraction $\frac{2 - 4 + 6 - 8 + 10 - 12 + 14}{3 - 6 + 9 - 12 + 15 - 18 + 21}$. The final answer is $\frac{2}{3}$.

a_1.informal problem: Find the value of the fraction $\frac{2-4+6-8+10-12+14}{3-6+9-12+15-18+21}$. Express your answer as a common fraction. The final answer is $\frac{2}{3}$.

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes num denom :: real
assumes h0 : "num = 2 - 4 + 6 - 8 + 10 - 12 + 14"
and h1 : "denom = 3 - 6 + 9 - 12 + 15 - 18 + 21"
shows  "num / denom = 2 / 3"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 What fraction is the same as \[
\frac{2-4+6-8+10-12+14}{3-6+9-12+15-18+21}?
\] The final Answer is \frac{2}{3}
 ### Proof
 We have \begin{align} &\frac{2-4+6-8+10-12+14}{3-6+9-12+15-18+21} \\ & \qquad = \frac{2(1-2+3-4+5-6+7)}{3(1-2+3-4+5-6+7)} \\ & \qquad = \boxed{\frac{2}{3}}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes num denom :: real
assumes h0 : "num = 2 - 4 + 6 - 8 + 10 - 12 + 14"
and h1 : "denom = 3 - 6 + 9 - 12 + 15 - 18 + 21"
shows  "num / denom = 2 / 3"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem: Find the value of the fraction formed by the sum of the series $2 - 4 + 6 - 8 + 10 - 12 + 14$ as the numerator and the sum of the series $3 - 6 + 9 - 12 + 15 - 18 + 21$ as the denominator. Express your answer as a common fraction. The final answer is $\frac{2}{3}$.
